intro: Phaeanthus tephrocarpus, commonly known as the tephrocarpus hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
